alert.note: Alert for Kendall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Kerr, southeastern Gillespie and northwestern Kendall Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Cypress Creek, or 10 miles northeast of Kerrville, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kerrville, Fredericksburg, Comfort, Stonewall, Luckenbach, Cain City, Tivydale, Old Tunnel State Park, Rocky Hill, Bankersmith, Cypress Creek, Blumenthal, Center Point, Albert, Grapetown, LBJ State Park and LBJ National Historical Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas.
